subject: Re:New Members level.
msgSnippet: ... willing ... willing to ... allow ... etc. My ... posts are ... we have ... years, ... to be ... message or ... Quickscript? ... something like ... I m just
messageBody:
--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "qiangcongming" <box100@...> wrote:
>
> i agree; a newsletter in QS is the way to go. i'll be happy to produce
> some material as well.
>
> --- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, amd64_hacker <amd64_hacker@>
> wrote:
> >
> > I think it's a good idea.
> > It might be better to do a newsletter in Quikscript rather than a
> > Quikscript newsletter though.
> > I'm sure that it must be possible to rustle together a couple of pages
> > of general-interest-stuff in Quikscript a couple of times a year.
> > And it would be good writing as well as good reading practice :)
> >
> > pgabhart wrote:
> > >
> > > Benjamin's suggestion of a semi-annual newsletter is interesting. Is
> > > there anyone in the group that has the expertise and interest in
> putting
> > > something like this together on a small scale? If someone were
willing
> > > to be the organizer, I am sure some other members would be
willing to
> > > contribute.
> > >
> > > By the way, due to incipient problems with spam two years or so ago,
> > > which we wanted to nip in the bud, the site was changed to only
allow
> > > posting by members who have proven themselves to be human and not
> > > shilling for some product that has nothing to do with QS.. In this
> > > manner, we are spared the advertisements for pharmaceuticals,
etc. My
> > > pattern has been to edit a member's membership so that their
posts are
> > > unmoderated after they have attempted to post a message. Since
we have
> > > a healthy number of lurkers, many members have been members for
years,
> > > but still do not have unmoderated privileges. If you would like
to be
> > > able to post at a moment's notice, then you need to post a
message or
> > > send me an email directly asking that your membership be updated to
> > > allow posting.
> > >
> > > Paige
> > >
> > > Benjamin Bruce wrote:
> > > >
> > > > That's great! I'm glad to know there's that many people interested
> > > > in it.
> > > >
> > > > I was just thinking of an idea. Wouldn't it be neat if someone
> > > > would start a small newsletter-type thing in and about
Quickscript?
> > > > Having it in PDF format on a website would probably be the best
> way to
> > > > go, and I know it would be good reading practice for all of us. I
> > > > know there's not much in the way of news about Quickscript, so it
> > > > would be, perhaps, a twice-a-year publication.
> > > >
> > > > Anyway, I just thought I'd pass that idea on, and see if anyone
> > > > wants to run with it. I don't have enough time to put
something like
> > > > this together, but I'd certainly be willing to contribute.
> > > >
> > > > -Benjamin Bruce
> > > > Parker County, Texas
> > > >
> > > > --
> > > > Check out BenjaBlog!
> > > > Weekly posts on interesting and unique topics.
> > > > Newest post: "Presidential Signature"
> > > > www.benjaminbruce.us/blog/ <http://www.benjaminbruce.us/blog/
> > > <http://www.benjaminbruce.us/blog/>>
> > > >
> > > >
> > >
> > >
> >
>
I'm just posting to let everyone know that I'm an actual human being
who's actually interested in a phonetic alphabet for the English language.

-Paul
